website_summaries.verdict: Incredible price and a very flexible unit. Not strictly a wireless access point, however, so that limits its use as one.
pros: Ridiculously easy to set up and it is a flexible unit — range extender, wireless access point, wireless bridge and router
cons: It's not strictly a wireless access point, so that means mounting options are limited and range is not as far as some competing products

website_summaries.verdict: The Securifi Almond's touch-screen novelty, while it works great, is not enough to make up for the lack of features and performance as well as the price tag.
pros: The Securifi Almond's touch screen offers a new and convenient way to set up and manage the router without the need of a computer
The router is compact and offers stable Wi-Fi signal
cons: The Securifi Almond's performance is just about average
You can't use the touch screen to manage all of its settings and its Web interface is also rather buggy

website_summaries.verdict: Securifi's Almond is the industry's first touch screen router. The device is attractive and easy to set up, but the hardware is only suited to those with light networking needs.
pros: Set up and manage with touchscreen

customer_reviews.title: Much less than satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I had the product for less than a year and it has stopped working. The touch screen is so light that nothing on it is viewable. After a while of it not working I got an email from the maker stating that there was a problem (I use apple products for the most part, but the ranger extender wasn't working with anything). Weeks later I got another email stating that the problem has been fixed. At that time I informed them of the continued problems I was having. That's been weeks ago and I have yet to hear anything from them.
customer_reviews.author: El Groovo 2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn't like a touch screen. The stylus is a little hard to pull out, but other than that it was a very easy experience to connect. I used it to extend WIFI to another building by setting up a bridge. Worked great and I now have WIFI.....
customer_reviews.author: david peed

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the Almond. I use it as a WAP. Strong signal, no problems. I like the interface. It has made electronic life in this home better. I don't know about their customer support because I have not needed it. Set up was easy, though it did take longer than 3 minutes. However, I am far from a network expert, and I could see how an expert could get it done in 3 minutes. I thought it seemed a little pricey, but now that I have had it 8 months, I would buy it again without hesitation. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Moccasin

customer_reviews.title: Securifi Almond
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I 'd purchased a Smart TV and it was slow to load video's. My router is all the way across the house, so the signal wasn't strong enough to load the videos on this end. Installed the Almond, and problem solved! It also bumped my signal through the rest of the house from 3 bars to the full 5. It's easy to install, and I'm so happy that I bought it. My videos from apps on the tv load seamlessly now. Thanks for making such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P.

customer_reviews.title: After 2 yrs, Changed From Extender to Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item two years ago to use as an extender for my current (different brand) router. That router recently stopped working, so I decided to try to convert this item to a router itself. Being from pre-computer-in-school-generation, it took me a few minutes to figure out to convert it, but actually was not difficult. Bottom Line: Using this item by itself is giving me as good a range as my old router coupled with this as an extender, if not better. (I couldn't get into some rooms in my house with just the previous router, which is why I bought this extender, but this Almond gets me into all the rooms and down the drive by itself)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: DOA after a short period (but of course out of warranty)
customer_reviews.text: I have had a love/hate relationship with this router/range extender. I bought two, using one as the router and the other as the range extender. I would get intermittent dropouts, once a week or so, that I don't get with other equipment in other residences. Today, after two years and five months (most of that time the router was unplugged and not in use as we were residing elsewhere), the one I was using as the router is dead. Won't reboot. No more Securifi products for this family.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: So worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Would give a 20 if could. I hae a two story house. Five bedrooms, den that we use WiFi. Could not get ay signal upstairs and loosing signal downstairs a lot. I set it in about 5 min sitting in my recliner. We have 7 people in the house all w phones, tablets, 2 smart tvs, and 2 yr has bay kindle. 6 to 7 of these are on WiFi at same time. Not only getting full signal up and downstairs but out at the pool as well. So worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: pernia1952

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable with suspect durability
customer_reviews.text: Simply too unreliable & non-durable item there are much better wifi extenders for 1/4th the price all of those will serve more reliably & consistently. Sheer headache to reach their literally non-existing customer service called them 8 times in last 13 days and not once did my call get through so much so that, I have developed immunity to their irritatingly robotic voice message after hearing it over-n-over again.
customer_reviews.author: En.N.Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device all around.
customer_reviews.text: I did an in depth test of 3 wifi to ethernet bridges. For testing I setup 3 beaglebone blacks with a cron task to run hourly the following script: root@bbb:/etc/cron.hourly# cat speed_script #!/bin/sh /usr/bin/speedtest-cli --simple >> /home/debian/speedtest.log echo "" >> /home/debian/speedtest.log Internet is gig fiber provided by an ASUS RT-N56U After a week here were the results (averaged values): Securifi Almond Ping(mS): 19.9 Download(Mbit/s): 26.1 Upload(Mbit/s): 20.2 Edimax EW-7438RPn Mini Ping(mS): 141.4 Download(Mbit/s): 33.1 Upload(Mbit/s): 43.5 IOGEAR GWU627 Ping(mS): 10.6 Download(Mbit/s): 16.2 Upload(Mbit/s): 11.8
customer_reviews.author: Benner

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: I got this about 2 years ago and kept trying to give it chances to impress me and freakin work and nope never proved itself worthy. My house is not even that big and I placed the extender in my backroom and it always discounts and reconnects every few minutes and very slow internet. Waste of money. Very annoyed I gave it a chance in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: There are better, more reliable options at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this as a range extender, but it never worked properly. Kept it anyway as it was past the return period. Installed it in mom's house two weeks ago to replace an elderly router. I should have kept the old router. The Almond didn't work as a range extender and was flaky at best as a router. It has now failed completely and is stuck on a boot screen. The actual usage time for this unit is less than 3 weeks. The UI is terrific but the quality just isn't there. There are better, more reliable routers out there at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: nybiblio

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this device for 6 or 7 years. It was a snap to set up and the touchscreen is easy to navigate. We have a three story house, so we put the router on the main floor and besides the occasional buffering while streaming Netflix or Hulu, the range is good. You can change the network name and password without going online. We just had our first issue with it and the customer service was A+. They responded to my email quickly and called me to patiently walk me through the troubleshooting. It’s working great again and the gentleman gave me his direct email in case I have any other issues. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Honey

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Product!
customer_reviews.text: I've used and set up dozens of these units. I have used them to make wired Cisco office phones, printers and computers work (wirelessly) in remote space where there is no cabling. I include them in all home office kits for home-based employees. The ease of setting these up is such that even the most technically challenged can do it quickly. I've never had one go bad or lose configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Apathicus

customer_reviews.title: Needs restarts daily. No updates published for it.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK when it works. Used to work like a champ when I bought it in 2014. Needs to be reset almost daily now. No software/firmware updates in a LOOONG time. Looks like it's falling behind the times as far as steam width and capabilities. I think it's becoming obsolete. I recommend buying something else. I won't buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: totallyfrozenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dead within a year of normal use. No help from Securifi.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend at all. Died within a year or normal use. Now at the very best it will push 5mbps when my modem is pushing 70mbps. Spent several hours on the phone with multiple people at Securifi and was given the run around with them not wanting to replacing the unit and insisting it must be the environment that its in. Asked for another unit under the warranty and was told to set up another time with them to troubleshoot yet again! Tired of this huge waste of time and will be forced to purchase another router. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: N. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: To me, the support for a product is only as good as its support. I called Securifi support today, Feb. 19, 2020. The agent, Sathya (located in Southern India) was fantastic. He was empathetic, patient, spoke perfect English and was dedicated to finding a solution to my connection issue. He never sounded rushed or that he was concerned with getting off the phone and going to the next person in line for support. He stayed with me until the job was done. Oh, I neglected to mention that I purchased my router/extender in 2014, 6 years ago, and I do not have any kind of extended warranty or service agreement! Now that's service! Thank you Securifi!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Bob

customer_reviews.title: Don't move or it will shut off
customer_reviews.text: I tried to set up the Almond WIFI but when I picked up the device the front screen went blank. I spent 2 hours trying to get this device to work but each time I moved the device, the front screen would go blank and I would have to restart the whole process of setting it up. The power light would remain on the whole time so I know this is an internal issue and not a power issue. I tried setting it up 5 times and each time if I moved the device the front screen would go blank. Sending back
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: One year, then Dead
customer_reviews.text: When first purchased 1 year ago the Almond found my WiFi signal, connected, and extended the WiFi range, which is why I purchased it. Since then, whenever losing the WiFi signal it has a hard time reestablishing connections. It will find the WIFI signal and attempt to sync with it, but always "times out". Yesterday it overheated and the screen just became a white nothing. From the reviews it appears to be good, just wanted to know what happened in my situation.
customer_reviews.author: kimmerdog

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this exclusively as a range extender and It worked great until I had to change my home router. Now, after having to enter a new password for the new router, it gets hung up and can't find the IP address. I've now seen the reviews about how this was a known defect and the company supposedly had stopped shipping the defective units. They didn't. I got this barely 4 months ago. I'm very disappointed and angry that the company (or Amazon, not sure whose fault it is) continues to sell the defective products. The window for returning it has closed, but I intend to keep pushing for a refund of my $70.
customer_reviews.author: D. Parker

customer_reviews.title: GOOD IN THE BEGINNING
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for some time and it was perfect, easy to use and straight forward UI. Over time, it started to deteriorate, for instance the app wasn't syncing as it used to. Then after a few more weeks it would automatically disconnect your and reconnect once or twice in a minute. I contacted the customer service and saw that it was pointless. Right now it's sitting somewhere in my room waiting to make a comeback, but until then, it remains disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: DQ

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a metal-enclosed tiny house about 80' from the main house where the modem is. My internet speed was a frustrating 50 kb. I had a hard time logging onto the internet and definitely was unable to upload images. The Almond changed it immediately to 11 MB. I now can stream movies and upload images quickly. AMAZING!!!! I am so grateful for this divice!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BrigBrown

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect as a Wi-Fi Extender as my room was a dead zone before but how it's a hotspot!
customer_reviews.author: Alexa N Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up. Works great! I'm using it as a extender and now my husband can watch all his movies without annoying pauses. We have a 1 story, 2400sf home with insulated inside walls which caused the Wi-Fi signal to be weaker at the far side of the house. Now I can even get great Wi-Fi in the attached 1200 sf garage. I like the look and the fact that there are not antennas sticking out. I also like that the screen can be set to show the time or the weather! (suggestion Securifi: time AND weather - I want it all, lol) I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lori F

customer_reviews.title: Initial hiccups, but steady since
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * Easy set up * Great range (we use it to extend the AT&T network) * Love the beta app for weather so we can have the outside temp showing all the time Cons: * Had to restart several times in the first week as it would lose internet access while the AT&T wifi still had internet. But it seems to have stabilized now, so I can't really explain what happened up front. * Screen is hard to read unless you are right in front of it at the right angle. Wish the weather app had a way to change the contrast so you could see the outside temp from across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Army Guy 2000

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for its price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router based on great Amazon reviews. Set up was really easy. Touch screen interface is all you need. No PC or laptops are needed for set up. 5 star in this category. However, This product is quite expensive compared with other products. There are several deficiencies in this product: * It only supports 2.4 Ghz band. 2 Star in this category. * There are only two Ethernet outlet/ports, while most other routers have at least 3 or more outlet/ports. 2 Star in this category. * Its technical capability is at or below average compared to other more advanced routers. * It's much more expensive than other products in the market with similar technical capability.
customer_reviews.author: WaterGap

customer_reviews.title: and have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I took the recommendation of CNet that this was the number one router/signal booster, and have not been disappointed. I needed it to function as a signal booster and since hooking it up haven't had a single "could not access the server". That said, I would highly recommend a redo of your setup instructions. I found them very confusing and has to call your tech support to get the setup done. Fortunately for me, your man Mirza was a GREAT resource, very patient and kind, staying with me until the unit was up and running!!! He may be the best tech support person I've ever dealt with! Thanks so much Mirza.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pike

customer_reviews.title: So far, the best for my network installs.
customer_reviews.text: As a service and install technician, this router is my go-to wireless router when my clients network fails or is not covered well enough. When I install a Ring.com product, a Yale lock or an August product, I ask the client to order an Almond and have it there by our appointment date. When I drive 1 - 2 hours for an install, I want to be sure the wireless network I install is going to work with any product I am installing. I don't want the hassle of having to return to finish. Securifi Almond does the job every time so far.
customer_reviews.author: theodore l mantas

customer_reviews.title: works great- will solve your dead spot problems
customer_reviews.text: second one I've had, both work great, but first one I inadvertently placed on an end table where the dog ran behind the couch and dragged the cord and off it went flying.... after about 3 or 4 times it zonked out, the dog killed it. So I got another. My expensive ATT router is pretty weak in one spot in house which happens to be where my lazy-boy is... so this I use as booster, and it hits the whole house and outside all around... it's pretty powerful, and it will use the same ID and password as my ATT router if that's how I want it and it works great, but you can program many different ways
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Does NOT Work.
customer_reviews.text: It does NOTHING. No improvement in signal strength. We live in an apartment house of 3 bedrooms. Not much to work with, is it? Also, sometimes, it gets kicked out of the wi-fi network for no reason. Then you have to log it in every time. This happened several times. Eventually I threw it out. My kids didn't notice the difference. Of course, there was no such a thing. I do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bond

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy setup. No hassle. Basically all you have to do is plug it in, create a Securifi account, and you're done. The router does the rest! A note for the designers: the unit should be able to flip (so that it can be placed on either the right or left side of a desk, shelf, etc.). !!!UPDATE!!! The unit's internet port has stopped working after just 15 months of use. I tried resetting, but the port is no longer functioning. There's no connection light on the port and it doesn't register as connected when plugged in (tested the cable, it's fine). The screen has also faded so badly that I can't read some of the menus anymore.
customer_reviews.author: The Critic

customer_reviews.title: It works great, giving me strong signal and good range
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a wireless access point in a corner bedroom, so that I can have wireless in my backyard. It works great, giving me strong signal and good range . My only complaint is that the set up instructions and wizards do not tell you how to use it as a wireless access point. I'm no tech dummy, but I had to figure it out by poking around and using the forum. By the time tech support got back to me it was a snooty "just go to settings" reply, but I'd already figured it out. Overall an excellent product. Using it with a netgear modem/router.
customer_reviews.author: Homescholar

customer_reviews.title: set up was easy and the performance is great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased an Almond as my original WiFi router, set up was easy and the performance is great. I can wirelessly stream videos and internet content without interruption. Purchased another as a repeater since the signal was weak in the lower part of the house [CMU wall and dirt backfill blocked the signal], now I have full coverage. Recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Markus Mumper

customer_reviews.title: Great range extender!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Almond that I purchased back in 2013 to use as a range extender. Our house is small but our walls are thick and the wifi signal weak. After daily use the original Almond finally gave up the ghost although it has been spotty this past month. It was a blessing to have and I immediately purchased another when I could not reset it. BTW, I place the Almond in the window so it actually sends signal into our backyard. Working outside is a luxury right now!
customer_reviews.author: gargrrryl

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this unit. Bought it to extend the WIFi signal at our seasonal campsite. I have been able to get two smart TVs connected where it was hit-or-miss connectivity before. I was able to create my own “network” name and secure it. Full signal on every device! The interface on the unit is really solid and easy to use. It even comes with its own stylus so I didn’t fat finger the keyboard as I was typing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morse

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece is s@$%
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this no stars I would. We’ve had this thing for about a year and it sucks. It’s worked for a while but the performance was never stellar. I also could never get it to hook up to the cloud. I wanted to contact the company today and I guess there’s a fake site out there because it tried to give me a virus. So! I’m getting a new extender and kicking this crap to the curb.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H. Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: This one worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I have had a problem with "fair" signal strength with my Roku smart TV for some time. I tried cheaper brands with limited success. I returned them all. I shelled out the bucks for the Securifi Almond on the advice of a friend and couldn't be happier. I am now receiving "excellent" signal strength for streaming and have yet to have any buffering interruptions. It was easy to set up because it does all the work for you. Some of the icons were unclear for me, but Securifi's customer service was readily available to help. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Casper

customer_reviews.title: From five stars to one star in about eight weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I am rapidly becoming convinced that all Wi-Fi units are actually pieces of garbage. This is the third unit, from the third company, that I've gone through in short order. The realistic approach to this Chinese junk is to take the price, divide by eight, and decide if the Wi-Fi it provides is worth it. This unit came out to about $10/week. Worth it? As I write this, I'm off Wi-Fi because the unit can't supply it only about sixty feet away and through three walls. Terrible! NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Austin reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff For Non-Techie
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about 'extenders' except what someone told me might solve my WiFi 'issue' on my daughter's gift 'Smart TV'. Netflix worked okay, but Amazon Prime reception was iffy -- I'm assuming [ what? I don't know these things at all! ]. So I did some 'research' (if online stuff counts), and the Securifi Almond seemed doable. It was. Not only has it made the WiFi work smoothly, but when I thought I was having a problem and contacted them (on phone, live person!), they patiently led me through what I needed to do. Of course, I was indeed 'the dummy' about all of it, but their patience, courtesy, and expertise was a relief -- technologically and personally.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N.

customer_reviews.title: Bad RAM Chip and Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Product is junk. Difficult to work with. Spent here and there years trying to get it to work right. Customer support wasted a ton of my time. Not cool when the product is junk. Just get a Netsys and call it a day.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. of Duck Soup

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a mobile hotspot.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Almond. It has surpassed every expectation I had for it. I live in a rural area with no internet access. I currently use a jetpack from Verizon as my internet in the house. It's range was 15 ft at best. With the Almond connected as an extended I now have internet access through out my entire house, including the basement. I live in a two story home and it is upstairs. Great product would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SweetdreamsC0z

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!!
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME. Took me less than 3 minutes to set up as I did not need to download app. from google play. I took my mac book pro to the garage which requires walking form the house, to the back yard where I was never able to get wifi before and I was able to to stream a movie with no buffering in both places! Am beyond pleased with the purchase. Incredibly easy set up and works like a dream ! Am so thankful for this and the price is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed  ...
customer_reviews.text: I just want to update my review after about 5 months having it. Besides it slowed down internet speed (at least 60% slower), It started stop working very often, and we have to go through the set up all over again. And the screen is all messed up, you literally can no longer read what's on it. Horrible waste of money I would say.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Some reliability issues but good product
customer_reviews.text: PROs - Touch screen, easy to use and setup. Handsome. - Can be used as smart hub, integrating sensors and devices - App is reliable, you can name and monitor your devices. I can shut down my kid's Ipad connection if needed - Both 2.5 and 5 Ghz wireless networks - Standby screen showing weather (no forecast) - Responsive tech support, and ability to send logs CONs: - Disconnects the internet from time to time, then comes again when I switch between 2.5 and 5. Tech support suggested some changes but did not help. - When it is stressed, it restarts itself, could be good or bad depending on timing
customer_reviews.author: Yavuz

customer_reviews.title: Needed a way to increase the wi-first signal in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a way to increase the wi-first signal in my house. The router is on one end and the signal was weak on the opposite end. I'm not a techie and wasn't even certain of what I needed to boost the signal but decided to give the Almond a try. It took five minutes to install and get it operating with the network. I went from one bar to full signal strength once the Almind was installed. My Roku found the increased signal and runs video from Amazon, Netflix and HBOGo without any buffering or delays. Should have installed the Almond months ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd Securifi Almond unit I have (tried)
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Securifi Almond unit I have (tried) to use in the past 4 years, hoping that the manufacturer will work the bugs out. Each time I purchase a unit, it always has the same issue of internet/wifi drop out. This will be the 3rd unit I've returned. Tried them at my home, my daughters home & this last time was at my office. What a shame. The idea of this unit is cool, but until the bugs are worked out on the drop out issue's, I won't be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed in my RV
customer_reviews.text: I am traveling in a camper and sometimes am placed far away from wifi repeaters. This has done the trick! It brings in wifi where nobody else gets it. I am very happy with the purchase. I save a lot of money in the long run with this device. It's a great product and extremely easy to set up. No technical knowledge necessary. It only took a few minutes. You have to move it around a little until you get the "best" reception. That's all!
customer_reviews.author: Dharma

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless- got to extend wifi into family room. I have a pretty good router but for whatever reason I can't get my smart tv to stream without buffering - we have a lot of devices on our network and I thought perhaps that was part of the problem. Not only did this not solve the problem, but no matter how close to the modem I put the device, it dropped the signal frequently and therefore rendered it useless.
customer_reviews.author: JenInMaine

customer_reviews.title: The advertisement of quick and easy setup prompted me to buy this unit
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement of quick and easy setup prompted me to buy this unit. That proved not to be true in my case. I have fiber optic and do not use a modem and the combination proved unworkable. I spent 3 hours on the phone with their support staff, who were as mystified as I was on my problem. They were very polite and professional and tried everything you could imagine to get it to work but without success.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little router
customer_reviews.text: All that I hoped for. As someone who is forced to use my mobile data plan tethering for home internet, I was looking for a router to provide some wifi functionality and boost signal strength. I originally bought another router but it never worked as a home network so I returned it and bought the securefi Almond. I didn't have high expectations when it arrived and I unboxed it but I was up and running in ten minutes, and loved both the look and functionality. My every expectation has been met or exceeded and I highly recommend the Almond, so much so that I intend to buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Stevie

customer_reviews.title: WiFi boosters
customer_reviews.text: Yep, it's right there in the manual - May not work on some networks as a booster. Xfinity, ATT dish, and others. I think that is worth mentioning in the descriptions - they should have a very good idea as to what major networks their device will not work on.
customer_reviews.author: Richard  Blakley

customer_reviews.title: Efficient product with excellent support services. A+
customer_reviews.text: What I disliked about this experience was my ineptitude, or at least the fact that it was clearly exposed to me. The blessing was in the support I received. Thea, the support staff who assisted me, stayed on the line for over an hour guiding me through the steps until the router was set up properly. The system works great and extends the WiFi signal adequately and consistently so that I no longer experience the frustrating loss of WiFi during critical moments in my work.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the positive reviews!
customer_reviews.text: It made a HUGE difference! Before setting it up, all my devices run at a speed of 50. Then, with this wifi extender that supposedly would strengthen the signal and extend the range, the speed drops to 10! Placed it right next to all my devices (Samsung TV, tablet, PC), and my own router is near the kitchen, like 10 feet away, with a wall in between. Tried placing it near the router, nothing worked. With this, I can't even open a webpage. Such a failure.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Great When It Works, But Can't Keep the Connection
customer_reviews.text: This is a great extender when it works. However, I have to call customer service (which is very good, BTW) to work through getting it to connect to my fairly new Fios router, and then the connection only lasts a week or two. Not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: SkierGuy

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL....PERSON I RECEIVED SERVICE FROM WAS TOP NOTCH-PATIENT, KIND AND THOROUGH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with my Almond that I had tried for days to figure out myself. I use mine as a range extender. I finally called the support line and the technician I got was absolutely AWESOME!!!! He was extremely patient with me as I don't know most of the technical jargon. Anyhow, he walked me step by step and helped me through all of it. I asked lots of dumb questions along the way and he had repeat it so I could understand what he was asking me to do. Again, calm and patient!!!I Could not have been more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: success2u

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my married daughter that was experiencing difficulty in their single level home connecting to many rooms without a little/no signal. I had it shipped to their home as a gift,most impressed by the advertised (3 minute) set up time. They contacted me, initially expressing gratitude, but subsequently verified the minimal set up time along with a great signal now throughout the entire home. Thank You!!!
customer_reviews.author: The 'ski' team from Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great range & love the app connecting it to my phone!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in February and wanted to use it for awhile before giving my review. First off it was super easy to set up and I like that it could connect with an app on my phone. We are using it as our router and the range is superior to our previous one. My husband can even pick up the wifi in his workshop out behind our house! We've had no issues with this router even during the high winds and power surges we get this time of year. Love the ability to track the activity of certain devices (kids) with the app on my phone! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Truly miraculous solution for large homes
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this product. First of all, a soothing cup of milk for the jittery technophobe--literally installed seamlessly in minutes! Does what it says and more, not only extending range but signal strength. Example: when running wifi in my room for streaming, the tv for which is located literally right next to my router, the Almond, located downstairs (!) provides with a stronger, more reliable signal. Recommend to absolutely anyone !!!
customer_reviews.author: Dsfaye

customer_reviews.title: Worth it or Was it?
customer_reviews.text: Was it! This item operates in accordance as described, however there's occasional shutoff for no reason, lost of signal for a while, sync in and out no reason. This item is mounted in the wall of my home as an extender and operates like so but the range for this product is not as described for the distant that this wireless Wi-Fi extender can't even reach a ten foot radius as from one room to the next. I'm sadly disappointed in this product given that I once thought highly of it and after sometime of use all the bad and negative out way the good
customer_reviews.author: Sam's Hand Crafted Roses

customer_reviews.title: Screen faded away after short time
customer_reviews.text: It works well for a while but screen faded away so it could not be read. I called service and they replaced with new one but it has happened again after few months. It is useless not because I can not read screen anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fuksa

customer_reviews.title: Gave it a College Try Without Success!
customer_reviews.text: I sure wish I had had the 5* experience that quite a few folks here have experienced but alas I didn't. My unit arrived on time (as is usual with Amazon) and it set up as advertised quite quickly with the exception that it hung on acquiring an IP address. I tried the factory reset/update that was suggested to another poster (3 times) without a positive result so I am returning it. My wifi network (sans an extender) is marginally adequate to cover my residence--I would be more comfortable with a stronger signal on the far end and in the associated patio. I obviously thought that the Almond was going to be that answer--it wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Howard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Touchscreen Menu & Setup... Mediocre Performance
customer_reviews.text: Hello Amazonians... The Securifi Almond is a great wireless router for someone not very tech savvy. The touchscreen menu is great to work with and super easy to manage. However, the performance did not meet my expectations. Within a few days of operation I began to experience stalling and slow speeds. I needed dual band wifi vs this (which is single band) for my style of wifi usage. I'm supposing most of the $69.99 cost went to developing the touchscreen and setup menu vs the actual performance of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fred

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, lower speed.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, please forgive any typos. Doing this from my phone. The Goods: 1. Easy setup 2. Small and compact. Easy to hide but can be left out. 3. Works well with a decent distance boosting the signal. The Bads: 1. Pretty much has crapped out after 4 months. Has to be rebooted several times a day to be able to use. 2. If you have high spped internet ( more than 15MB ) this is not for you unless you want to punish the kids. Max speed I have been able to achieve is 14MB. I can get 60 to 100+off the cable modem. Hope this helps someone with thier decision.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Julian

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Not good when it was working, goes dead for 5-10 minutes randomly about every two hours. Power cycling does help but I got to the point that I would power cycle every morning for good measure. Now after 2-3 months it did a software update and it has frozen up, unresponsive to anything, even the reset button. I am not an official "IT" guy but by default I manage the network at my office so I know what I am doing and I know what I am saying when I say they need a few more iterations on this product, maybe in future, but this is a like a beta demo with so many bugs
customer_reviews.author: Richard H

customer_reviews.title: Had to go on line to fine an actual manual not just a user guide
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues initially but it was for my lack of knowledge and limited directions on works or not. I still think the manual or directions need enough detail for a novice to work out not just those with a wealth of experience. The guide is too vague in what is to be done and how it works. Had to go on line to fine an actual manual not just a user guide. Still too little info for my taste. Will determine how well it will work over time and if the signal drops off. I do like the monitor screen.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Works well with concrete/cinderblock construction
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was heading home to the Caribbean on vacation and with concrete/cinderblock construction I was unsure how reliable my wifi signal would be. I had no issues so I gave to my cousins, they shared a family modem and wifi. The connection was in the 3rd floor apartment of one cousin and they shared it in the 2nd floor apartment. Their signal improved drastically!! No dropped signal and no need to be tethered to one spot to use wifi. If I could give 10 I would. Almost a year later and it's still going strong. Great product I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luclu

customer_reviews.title: Just another garbage product
customer_reviews.text: I got my hopes up with this extender since I have no internet connection in my basement and it has some decent reviews, but boy was I misled. This thing actually slowed down my connection every where else in my house. Even though I now have internet in my basement, it's essentially useless because it is usually about 50-500 kb/s in download speed, aka dial up speeds, and my ping averages 300ms with peaks of 1500ms so I can't play online games. DON'T BUY THIS GARBAGE OVERPRICED PAPER WEIGHT
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Never got the code. No customer service. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Second crappy extender I have purchased on Amazon. This one very expensive. You do not get what you pay for. First you have to set up an account and download an app. This alone takes more than the "3 minute" setup advertised. Then, you are supposed to receive a code to continue setup. In my case, the code was not forthcoming. No tech support on weekends - when almost everyone does their setup. So there you go...
customer_reviews.author: August Williams

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up.  Excellent Performance.
customer_reviews.text: True to it's advertisement, I was able to unbox and set up the Almond on my home network as a range extender is 3 minutes - maybe less. The touch screen works great. The instructions included in the box where clear and easy to follow. The phone App was easy to navigate and use. With the range extender in place, I now have excellent WiFi signal throughout my home and into my yard for several feet. I am very happy with this purchase and the performance of the product. Plug it in. It works. That's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: msj

customer_reviews.title: Good router for good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I am using it as an access point for an almond+. Between the two of thwm, my transfer rate jumpes up 4x from my old ddwrt ac1450 router. It plugged right in, I entered access point mode, and it took the my homs network and gave itself a different channel than the main router. They are both recognized by my netwoek scanning software. I am pretty sure that some of my devices jump from one to the othwr, as necessary. Thus plus the almond+ cover my house better and cheaper than some of the other routers i was looking at. My 300 is connected by cat5 ethernet wire, not wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: Gundamman

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastically (restarts correctly after power failures)
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for several months and it has performed admirably. I have purchased several wifi extenders and repeaters. While some of them were just as easy to setup, they didn't handle power failures or didn't run on a generator properly. I live in a rural area that is prone to power failures. The generator kicks in after thirty seconds, but no other solutions were as trouble-free as this one. This unit has never failed to startup correctly after a power loss. It operates on the sketchy "dirty" voltage coming from the generator. It works as it it is advertised and gives me wifi in the areas of the house that lacked it.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Yea it has a super fast set up but it puts out super slow ...
customer_reviews.text: It is ok. Yea it has a super fast set up but it puts out super slow speeds. I have 60 meg internet speeds but I was only ever hitting around 20 with this device. I eventually broke down and spent substantially more on a google mesh wifi. I regularly hit 59-61.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy to set up , has a touch screen, it can be used as a router or a WiFi extender !!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best and eAsiest router that I have ever purchased, it is so easy to use and it is more than just a router it gives many options on what you want to use it for , its touch screen works awesome and it also comes with a stylus pen discreetly inserted in its base for use on the touch screen!! I love how you do not need to get on your computer or phone to set it up you do it right on the touch screen, the lust goes on and on about why I love this new router, I have already recommended it to friends and family !! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: I am giving them 3 start for good customer service and making the warranty replacement relatively painless
customer_reviews.text: I was using this as a range extender. The first month the connection dropped frequently. Not sure what changed, but that problem went away. Now display has faded to the point that it is unreadable. I contacted Securifi and after sending them pictures or the display, serial numbers, order numbers & MAC, they emailed me a shipping label. Once they see I have shipped the old one I will get a new one. I am giving them 3 start for good customer service and making the warranty replacement relatively painless, but I am not impressed with product. Glad I am not using it as a wireless router or I would be without wireless wifi waiting for the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Beth P-R

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Every single time this experiences a power fluctuation, it loses all ability to either auto connect or even connect manually to the network. It takes me at least 20 minutes to get it to reconnect as a range extender after a power outage - and I have not got that kind of free time just hanging about. Going to buy something that actually works now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible easy to setup and install, worth the price !!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wifi server. Took about 3-5 minutes to setup (had a beer or three while setting it up ^_^). The screen commands are non-technical" friendly and setting up the Wifi was very simple . There's a "Guest user option" that prevents the 'guest to hack the Securifi" , but still have wifi access the setting comes turned off by default. Not having to go thru a Web browser interface for this Router/Wi Fi unit is purer heaven. The option to see how many users and to block unwanted peepz is a breeze. The best bet for the screen options is to use a standard "generic" tablet stylus if you have giant fingers like me.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Kosowan

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not well
customer_reviews.text: Installed this, everything works, but the signal strength 40 feet away from the unit on the same floor through one door is no better than the wireless router in the basement through sub-flooring and 3 walls. I have ample knowledge of wireless networks run a pretty complex camera system through my home, so I do believe it is just that the device doesn't work in my home like it should. I was expecting and signal strength from this device that was excellent given I don't have a large space to cover and just a single story home with a basement. The router is literally right in the middle of the house.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!  As Advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect; working from home. Router on the first floor and office on the 2nd floor; did not want to run a 50' RJ-45 cable or have someone come out and put a second router. The Securifi Almond bridged the gap.between my 1st floor router and 2nd floor VPN. Connectivity has never been so good. My corporate office IT folks did not push back as they still consider the VPN secure with the Securifi Almond as the bridge between the router. Could not be happier with its performance. Yes, 3-minutes, maybe even less to set it up right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very strong signal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for sole purpose of using as a wap. What took most people minutes to do it actually took me about ten minutes to set up. I'm no network expert but the set up wizard doesn't include access point option, only router or extender. You have to bypass the set up and select access point. Anyways, once set up, wifi range and signal is amazing. I'm getting faster connection ( over 60mbps ) with the almond wifi vs WIRED CONNECTION to my main router. Miles better than my relatively new netgear router I converted to a wap.
customer_reviews.author: Cabby

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with some routers as a range extender
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine until I had to replace my router. I bought a Netgear RS350. The solution offered was "reset to factory settings" which I did, and "make sure your software is updated" which I did. Nothing works. Research indicates this has been a known problem for 7 at least the past 7 years so check and make sure it works with your router before buying.
customer_reviews.author: I'm a mom

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the product we needed for our office space. This extended our WIFI so that we could hook up a payment processing machine, when the direct internet line was in another room. My only complaint is that it often needs to be reconnected to get the connection. This usually happens 2-3 times a day, at the same times. It's quick and easy to reconnect, it's just an annoyance really. It could be our internet connection also, but it's a good device for not a lot of money and does exactly what it should for our business.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne Krager

customer_reviews.title: Great to get strong home signal to dead zone!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at my camper but that is because of the satellite provider not this device. Placed instead in our detached garage behind our house and it was super simple to get a full strength signal out there where there was none before!! My 22yo son and his friends are thrilled the garage now gets all the signal strength they could hope for whil working out there!
customer_reviews.author: KCant

customer_reviews.title: it looks nice and cute but packed more power
customer_reviews.text: it seriously beats my $290 Netgear's Nighthawk ultimate wifi(the most expensive top of their line). its signal is stronger and can go around metal blinds or metal furnace to reach my far to reach room and still gives strong signals(3 bar on iphone) while my $290 netgear can't(0 bar). over the course of past 4 years, I bought 3 netgear nighthawk for my large house. 2 netgear both died after 1 year of use. this almond wifi has been used for a year and still holds. it's smaller yet signal much stronger than netgear. it looks nice and cute but packed more power. very pleased, would recommend to next buyer.
customer_reviews.author: ijumptothetop28

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and functional too!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Easy setup and I was able to place it on an end table in my living room. The fact that it has the current outside temperature makes it look great, and is nice extra function to have. The app is also great and lets me know what devices are using the extended power. My Amazon dot started acting up when we had people over to our home and they all signed on to our network. This has solved the problem. I deducted one star because I would have preferred this device in white. But otherwise it was and is GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: The only product I could find to suit my purposes, and it works great
customer_reviews.text: My father moved into an assisted living that broadcasts their own wifi internet. My father needed to connect to the internet from a PC with no wifi driver. He did not want to install anything on his PC or use a USB antenna. This worked perfectly. You can get information from a browser. Nice little touch is that we set the display to the local weather and temperature. My dad can see it. Entering information would be too difficult for him to both see or manage with his hands. So I took one star away because it did not automatically reconnect after a wifi outage. He had to wait until I could come by and fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Rountree

customer_reviews.title: I’d like some recommendations if any other Amazonian have any
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of issues with this extender. I'm constantly losing connection with my main router and the signal (bars) are always stronger on main router. Doesn't seem right, right? I've emailed support several times ( probably 3-4) and the only response I get is The one that states that a customer service representative will be contacting me within 24 hours. That Hasn’t happened. I’d like some recommendations if any other Amazonian have any .
customer_reviews.author: Curious.D

customer_reviews.title: Improved Wifi connection on my Macbook
customer_reviews.text: My previous router would regularly drop the connection on two of my Mac computers (A Mac Mini, and a Macbook), though other mobile devices and a PC laptop were just fine. Now with the Almond router the connection doesn't ever drop and my connection is faster and generally more reliable. Unfortunately the Wifi still isn't good enough for voice conversations through my Macbook. However when I connect ethernet directly from the Almond to my Macbook the connection is great for voice conversations, so I suppose my Macbook's Wifi is going to have to be the one to blame. Again though, even though my Macbook apparently has Wifi issues, the Almond router did improve things quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jorb

customer_reviews.title: Affordable alternative for RV
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product as a WIFI extender. It is extremely easy to set up. (The "Setup Wizard" that appears on the device's screen, provides setup completion in 1 minute or less. This is an affordable alternative for RV camping. I have connected it to 2 different weak signals. I was able to stream videos when it was connected to my home WIFI system. (The ability to stream when connected to a campground system would probably be less likely, but would probably be sufficient for most other uses). I found it worked more efficiently when placed in an RV window.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Vann

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup, but poor wifi performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Securifis and was able to configure the device within about 10 minutes with the touchscreen menu. All Wifi system should have touchscreen. However, the bandwidth is not up to par and nowhere near the advertised 400Mbps. I was only able to clock 50Mbps max. on both units.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATED**Six days short of having this extender for 1 year and 1 month it has totally crapped out. I am standing literally 3 ft from the wireless modem and it won't connect and has been acting even worse than normal for a month. It doesn't stay connected. Drops constantly and EVERY time another device connects it drops the first one. This is a terrible product and should be avoided at all costs.*** This extender doesn't like to be used by more than one device. As soon as a second device is connected the first one disconnects and you lose connection. The devices say full connection but it drops off and disconnects "avoiding poor connection". Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: Surfing the interwebs
customer_reviews.text: All you need to know is your wi-fi password and the device does everything else for you. It does require the setup of another network but the dead areas in my house were the bedrooms so it isn't a bother to simply connect to the right one and state always connect. I have a ranch house and the Fios comes in one end and this was put at the end of the house. Now the bedrooms have a stronger signal.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous!!! I purchased one in 2014 and it was o.k. It died and I didn't replace it, just suffered low to non existent power on my computer that was far away from the modem. I gave in and bought another. It looks identical as the previous model and was just as easy to set up However, I now have full power!! Yea. And, only $89, not hundreds. Thank you Almond.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The Securfi Almond was ready to go out of the box. The reason for the purchase was to use as a Range Extender. We had spotty wifi signal on the second floor and now that we have placed this up there I have no issues connecting my devices. I would recommend this product to others who need to utilize this as a range extender. It does have other functions I just have not used them as of yet. The upside to this is that the touchscreen goes to "sleep" so that it does not shine bright 24/7
customer_reviews.author: Tlknox

customer_reviews.title: Works great, until screen starts to go
customer_reviews.text: We got this product back in October and it had worked beautifully with no problems until today. We noticed the wifi signal on our devices went out so we checked the router. The screen is fuzzy, faded, and almost unreadable. Some parts of the screen you actually can't see. If you hold it a certain way, you can sometimes make out a couple of words.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money and time!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst router that I have! I have an internet from spectrum with maximum speed of 200Mb. After installation check the internet speed and it's only 40mb for download and 10mb for upload!!!! Then I Bought Google wifi and check the internet speed!!! Unbelievable it's 220mb gor download and 11mb for upload. I called the customer service and no any help from them!!! I will return this junk asap. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Best Extender due to Touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Our son worked for your company in 2014 for about 6-7 months. He hooked us on your product. It is so much easier to create a house wide wifi system with your product because it has a touchscreen. We bought this one as a spare in case our other one goes out. When someone moves into a new house, we buy them one to extend their wifi. Our friends are happy with the product. Our son is doing well and is still working in the tech industry and he learned so much working with you there in Taiwan.
customer_reviews.author: Robin & David Murray

customer_reviews.title: Seems to live forever
customer_reviews.text: Setup didn't go nearly as easily as expected, the router refused to link to my phone. I did eventually get it sorted out, but it was a hassle. Also, after owning it for a little over a month, there's a white line running down the touch screen. Not that big a deal, but annoying. The router itself works great, though. Nice strong signal. Edit October 2019: I originally gave this router three stars, I decide to change it to four. I've owned it for about three years now. It's the longest-lived router I've ever owned by a wide margin. Based on that alone, I'd buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worth every byte
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this router for 18 months. I expected issues with the new technology, but I havent had one. It is Alexa compatable and if any of your smart devices need a hub, Almond provides the wireless bridge thru its router. Everytime I think I have learned it all, it shows me something new. This router is a pure joy to own.
customer_reviews.author: Thorough Edits/ Dayna Barret

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 years!! I purchase this to use it as a range extender. 3 years later This thing still works like a champ and when called the support number for updates and hung up cause they were closed Sathya called me back!! And provided the greatest service ever . Get yourself one today Look no further ! You will be happy. Thank you .
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Saadat

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pretty casual user and want something simple to use. I've had many routers in the past and I can say this is the best I've ever used. I have two, one set up as an extension. It's been working flawlessly for 2 straight years. We get frequent outage here, the extension will power right back on and pick up were it left off prior to the outage. No need to re-pair or anything. It's worked so well that I'm hesitant to upgrade to the newer model to take advantage of the new Wi-fi standards. I've had my share with tech issues, burning phones, etc. Happy to have a simple device that just works.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I'm 66 years old and hardware is not my thing. But I was being plagued by neighbors stealing my bandwidth so I looked for a new device that I could operate. Setting it up was a breeze. I connected to the cable, Directtv, 3 TVs, my cell phone and my kindle all by myself!!!! I've only had occasion to contact support since then and their assistance was fast and responsive to my problem (which turned out to be a cable issue unrelated to Securifi). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R B

product_meta.title: Securifi Almond - (3 Minute Setup) Touchscreen Wireless Router/Range Extender
feature_bullets: 95% of customers SET IT UP IN 3 MINUTES using Touchscreen Wizard; World's 1st TOUCHSCREEN Router
NO PC/Mac/CD needed for Setup or Management
MULTI PURPOSE USAGE: Use as primary WiFi Router or Range Extender or Access Point or Wireless Bridge - No built-in DSL modem
UNIVERSAL RANGE EXTENDER MODE: Compatible with any existing router (eg: Netgear, Linksys, Belkin etc.); COMPATIBLE WITH PC, Windows, Mac, Linux, iPhone, iPad, Android, XBOX
1 YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY and UNLIMITED TECHNICAL SUPPORT. Technical Support: +1 (855) 969 7328 or support@securifi.com

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars13,202 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
